intro: Spiraea henryi var. omeiensis, commonly known as the Omei spiraea, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pink flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it suitable for garden cultivation. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its compact growth habit and showy floral display.
